title: U.S. Coast Guard Pursues Oil Tanker Linked to Venezuela
summary: The latest vessel to be targeted by the United States in its pressure campaign on Venezuela was sending distress signals as it headed northeast from the Caribbean into the Atlantic.

title: At Turning Point Fest, Vance Refuses to Take Sides in Fight Over Bigotry
summary: The vice president’s plea for a big-tent coalition at an annual conservative gathering belied the cracks in his party over antisemitism, racism and conspiracy theories.

title: ‘60 Minutes’ Pulled a Segment. A Correspondent Calls It ‘Political.’
summary: Sharyn Alfonsi, a “60 Minutes” correspondent, criticized the network’s decision to remove her reporting from Sunday’s edition of the show.

title: Russia Dismisses Reports of Progress in Ukraine Peace Talks
summary: Proposals that emerged in recent negotiations with the United States were “rather unconstructive,” a Kremlin official said on Sunday.

title: Michele Singer Reiner: A Life Rooted in Activism and Listening to Others
summary: Michele Singer Reiner was the guiding force in the lives of her family, stressing the need to help and respect one another.

title: As Regional Theaters Struggle, Some Defy the Odds
summary: Naples, Fla., and Milwaukee are quite different, but have one thing in common: They are home to regional theaters that are thriving.

title: Sikh Truckers Found Refuge In Trucking Until The Trump Administration’s Crackdown
summary: Two high-profile crashes and a Trump administration crackdown have brought worry, and wariness, to the community.

title: Guns from the United States are Pouring into Canada, Fueling a Spike in Gun Violence
summary: The proliferation of illegal firearms from the United States has fueled a spike in gun violence in Canada, where most guns used in crimes are smuggled across the border.

title: How China Tried to Dismantle a Major Underground Church
summary: Videos and photographs show how the Chinese authorities have tried to dismantle Zion Church, a Christian network with branches across the country.

title: ‘Orwellian Climate of Fear’: How China Cracks Down on Critics in the U.S.
summary: The Chinese government once focused on political dissidents and exiled activists. Now, federal officials say, it is targeting artists in the United States whose creative protests test its tolerance.

title: When Did Everything Become ‘K-Shaped’?
summary: What started as a term to describe the pandemic recovery has become a catchall in these anxious economic times.

title: How Many Toys Will Parents Buy for Their Kids This Christmas?
summary: Ynon Kreiz, the chief executive of Mattel, believes consumers squeezed by tariffs and inflation will cut back on other things before they skimp on Barbies and Hot Wheels.

title: Waymo Suspended Service in San Francisco After Its Cars Stalled During Power Outage
summary: The self-driving cars came to a halt at intersections when the power outage knocked out traffic signals, causing tie-ups but no accidents or injuries.

title: 600 Readers Told Us About the Best Gifts They Ever Got. These Are the Top 13.
summary: We asked readers to tell us about the most memorable presents they’ve received.

title: France Needs a New France
summary: The time has come for a Sixth Republic.

title: Heavy Rains Bring Flooding to Northern California
summary: As floodwaters submerged cars and prompted rescues in the state’s far north on Sunday, forecasters warned that Central California would receive heavy rain later in the week.

title: Older Americans Quit Weight-Loss Drugs in Droves
summary: In some studies, half of patients stopped taking GLP-1s within a year despite the benefits, citing the expense and side effects.

title: Élysée Palace Silver and Tableware Stolen by Steward, Prosecutors Say
summary: In what prosecutors say was an inside job, copper pots, porcelain and Baccarat Champagne glasses were stolen from the inventory of the Élysée Palace.

title: James Ransone, Actor Known for ‘The Wire,’ Dies at 46
summary: The character actor had grown up in Maryland, where “The Wire” was set, and went on to star in horror films like “It Chapter Two.”
